body_content.explanation: the fact of being far away in distance:
examples: Space enthusiasts will marvel at the beauty and remoteness of Pluto.
The advantages of equatorial sea launches include remoteness from populated areas.

body_content.explanation: the fact of being far from any towns or cities:
examples: Getting medicine to them is difficult due to the remoteness of the villages affected by the quake.
The area is not likely to attract too many visitors because of its remoteness.

body_content.explanation: the fact of being far away in time:
examples: The past perfect tense emphasizes the remoteness of the action from the present moment.

body_content.explanation: the fact of not being closely related to something:
examples: Charlotte felt a numb remoteness from the wider world.
The popular association with modern art is its remoteness from the symbols and values of the majority of people.

body_content.explanation: behaviour that is not very friendly and shows little interest in other people:
examples: Fame and success only heightened his angry remoteness.
Liv's remoteness and Will's absorption in his work combine to put a strain on their marriage.
